name: Forking a Rad Mass - Anagrams For Kids Online Quiz  | 10 Questions

questions.text: The CHEATER told me to raise my hand in class if I had a question.
questions.explanation:
Teacher.

	A cheater is someone who copies test answers from someone else. A teacher is someone who teaches you what you need to learn in school.

questions.text: As I was walking home from school, a could hear a firetruck RINSE in the distance.
questions.explanation:
Siren.

	To rinse means to wash off lightly with water.  For instance, you might rinse off dishes before putting them in the dishwasher. A siren is a loud alarm.  On a firetruck, an ambulance, or a police car, the siren helps others so they know when one of these vehicles is near so they can be given as much room on the road as they need.

questions.text: I like to hang out with my best FINDER at his house after school.
questions.explanation:
Friend.

	A finder is someone who locates something that is lost. A friend is someone who you enjoy being with, and they enjoy being with you.

questions.text: My favorite RESIGN as a kid was Tim McGraw.
questions.explanation:
Singer.

	To resign means to stop doing something.  For instance, if someone resigns as the class president, they have stopped being the class president. A singer is someone who sings music for a living.  Sometimes they write their own songs, but others have people who write their music for them to sing. Another anagram for singer is signer.

questions.text: When I go BLOWING, I can never hit all ten pins to get a strike.
questions.explanation:
Bowling.

	When it is windy outside, people sometimes say that the wind is "blowing".  You can also blow with your mouth by forcing air out of your mouth. Bowling is a sport where you try to knock all the pins down using a heavy ball.  The pins are far down a bowling alley, and you must the ball all the way to the end without falling in the gutter and knocking as many pins down as possible.

questions.text: Most of the kids in my class are right-handed, but I am FELT-handed.
questions.explanation:
Left.

	Felt is a type of fabric.  It can also mean that you touched something.  It is the past tense of "feel". Left is a direction that you can turn after going straight, and can also mean anything on that side.  To remember which is your left hand (and left side), hold up your hands directly in front of you and spread your thumb and finger apart.  The hand that makes an "L" is your left.

questions.text: It was very cold outside this morning, so I had to wear a TACO.
questions.explanation:
Coat.

	A taco is a Mexican food that contains a hard or soft shell filled with meat, lettuce, and cheese (and other stuff, depending on who made the taco). A coat is a heavy jacket that keeps you warm in the really cold weather.

questions.text: You have to be careful with knives and scissors, because they can be very HARPS.
questions.explanation:
Sharp.

	Harps are musical instruments.  They are often seen being played by angels in paintings and on cartoons. If something is sharp, it can cut things.  Playing with scissors and knives is not a good idea, because they are sharp and you can hurt yourself!

questions.text: In the summertime, I like to plant tomatoes in my DANGER.
questions.explanation:
Garden.

	Danger is something that is not safe.  For instance, it is a danger to run with scissors.  You should never do it! A garden is where you plant all sorts of things.  You can plant vegetables, flowers, and other plants in a garden. Gander and ranged are other anagrams of garden.

questions.text: This is the DEN of the quiz, so I hope you had fun!
questions.explanation:
End.

	A den is a place where bears sleep.  It can also be a room in your house with books and desks to help you study. The end means there is nothing left.  For instance, it is the end of this quiz, so there are no more questions left.
